authors.name: sjwong
authors.note: Department of Cell Biology, Blavatnik Institute, Harvard Medical School, Boston, Massachusetts

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dlh0g","text":"The 2,4-dinitrophenylhydrazine (2,4-DNPH) alpha-ketoglutarate detection assay was developed to support the study of prolyl hydroxylase domain (PHD) proteins in a substrate-independent manner. This protocol was extensively optimized for the PHD protein reaction, and is applicable to the study of enzyme kinetics or to high-throughput screening. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

documents.ofn: 2021-01-23 2,4-DNPH assay protocol for deposition to protocols.io.docx

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"dfujb","text":"The following materials must be prepared fresh: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f77ol","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah1q4","text":"1 mM iron (II) sulfate: Prepare 500 mM in 20 mM HCl, then dilute to 1 mM in water just before use (Hewitson, K. S., Schofield, C. J., \u0026 Ratcliffe, P. J. (2007). Hypoxia-inducible factor prolyl-hydroxylase: purification and assays of PHD2. Methods in enzymology, 435, 25–42. https://doi.org/10.1016/S0076-6879(07)35002-7)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":239,"length":21},{"style":"italic","offset":262,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8ljb","text":"PHD enzyme source: frozen stocks may be use, but fresh enzyme is best, especially for PHD3 due to its lability.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68gsb","text":"2,4-dinitrophenylhydrazine (2,4-DNPH): Dissolve in 0.5 M phosphoric acid, let stand for 30-60 mins, then add water to intended concentration. Filter through 0.45 µM filter to remove precipitate.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: Samantha J. Wong, Alison E. Ringel, William Yuan, Joao A. Paulo, Haejin Yoon, Mark A. Currie, Marcia C. Haigis, Development of a colorimetric α-ketoglutarate detection assay for prolyl hydroxylase domain (PHD) proteins, Journal of Biological Chemistry, Volume 296, 2021, 100397, ISSN 0021-9258, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jbc.2021.100397.

500 mM in 20 mM HCl, then dilute to 1 mM in water just before use ."],["-ketoglutarate","20 mM","0.5 mM",""],["Peptide","20 mM","100 µM","Dissolved in DMSO"],["PHD enzyme source","20 µM","10 status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7g789","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6105p","text":"Prepare 5 Eppendorf tubes containing 50 µl of 10% TCA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80vm2","text":"Label tubes: 0 min, 1 min, 2 min, 5 min, 15 min.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3s1jf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcvta","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5k0v6","text":"Prepare cofactor solution containing HEPES/MES, catalase, DTT, ascorbic acid, FeSO4, a-ketoglutarate, and peptide in a 150 µl volume in an Eppendorf tube (using the working concentrations).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":82,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"187cn","text":"Add 150 µl of 20 µM PHD enzyme into the cofactor solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d22ok","text":"Vortex briefly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aiisu","text":"Place into a 37 oC tabletop shaking incubator and start the timer (counting up).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":16,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14jaf","text":"This step equilibrates the temperature of the reaction to 37 oC","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":61,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"em8r0","text":"At T = 1 min on the timer, withdraw 50 µl of the reaction solution and quench in the “0 min” tube containing 10% TCA, and replace the reaction tube in the incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ejq5","text":"Repeat this for the other time points.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lob5","text":"At T = 2 min, withdraw 50 µl of the reaction solution and quench in the “1 min” tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"286le","text":"At T = 3 min, withdraw 50 µl of the reaction solution and quench in the “2 min” tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vq2e","text":"At T = 6 min, withdraw 50 µl of the reaction solution and quench in the “5 min” tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsf54","text":"At T = 16 min, withdraw 50 µl of the reaction solution and quench in the “15 min” tube","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"75ajj","text":"Briefly vortex the quenched reactions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ftrj","text":"Keep the quenched reactions at 4 oC until ready for downstream processing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":33,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2n1l","text":"Reactions have been stored up to 3 days with no loss of signal.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aqpoe","text":"Centrifuge the quenched reactions at 13,000 rpm for 15 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ec2ib","text":"Meanwhile, add 10 µl of 0.5 M sodium phosphate to 5 wells of a 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kble","text":"Transfer 90 µl of the supernatant of the quenched reaction to a well containing 10 µl of 0.5 M sodium phosphate (VT = 100 µl).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":114,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87ub6","text":"Do the same for the other 4 quenched supernatants.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brt6b","text":"Using a multi-channel pipette, add 100 µl of 50 mM 2,4-DNPH to the wells (VT = 200 µl). Pipette up and down gently to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":75,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aufi3","text":"Leave at room temperature for 20 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6hql","text":"Using a multi-channel pipette, add 50 µl of 6 M NaOH to the wells (VT = 250 µl). Pipette up and down gently to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":68,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a4hgd","text":"Leave at room temperature for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b2q0r","text":"Read at 425 nm on a spectrophotometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"n1pf","text":"Calculate the amount of a-ketoglutarate consumed from a corresponding standard curve processed in exactly the same way as the samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":98,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ut4","text":"Plot the amount of a-ketoglutarate consumed against time, to obtain a curve that looks like this:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"985i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14s83","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cmt8","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"19fpm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"A1EDEF60516311ECA0994371D95B0534","height":262,"id":188905,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Linear range.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f2rmbpinx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f2rjbpinx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f2rkbpinx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f2ribpinx.webp","width":396}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ge47","text":"The initial rate should be taken as the linear portion of the curve. In this case, from T = 0 to 2 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cvq19","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1rsbg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"DF3530E0516311ECA0994371D95B0534","height":303,"id":188909,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Assay schematic.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f2rrbpinx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f2rpbpinx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f2rqbpinx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f2rnbpinx.webp","width":550}}}}
